intro.p: Answer the following questions about Euclidean subspaces.

outtro.p: U is a subspace and W is not.
W is a subspace and U is not.
Show that the closure of Q under either vector addition or scalar multiplication fails. For example: {{Q_valid}} belongs to Q, but 2{{Q_valid}}={{Q_invalid}} does not.

First show that R is closed under vector addition, since if {{v}}\in R because it satisfies {{R_eq}}, and {{valt}}\in R because it satisfies {{R_eq_alt}}, then {{v}}+{{valt}}\in R also as it satisfies {{R_eq_sum}}.
Then show that R is closed under scalar multiplication, since if {{v}}\in R because it satisfies {{R_eq}}, and k is a scalar, then k{{v}}\in R also as it satisfies {{R_eq_mul}}.
